metadata.title: Fortinet-FortiGate-IPEnrichment
metadata.description: This playbook enriches the incident with address object and address group.
prerequisites:
- Sentinel IP block group should create in the VM 

 - Function App needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription. Relevant instructions can be found in the Function doc page.
mainSteps:
When a new Microsoft Sentinel is created, this playbook gets triggered and performs below actions: 

 - It fetches details of the address object. 

 - It retrieve the details of address groups which address object is belongs to. 

 - Add the Summary of address object and its groups details to an incident.
postDeployment:
** a. Authorize connections ** 

 Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection. 

 1. Click the Microsoft Sentinel connection resource 

 2. Click edit API connection 

 3. Click Authorize 

 4. Sign in 

 5. Click Save 

 ** b. Configurations in Sentinel ** 

 - In Microsoft sentinel analytical rules should be configured to trigger an incident with IP Entity. 

 - Configure the automation rules to trigger this playbook

metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace

body.message:
Fortinet Playbook ran and fetched the below Information:
@{variables('commentDes')}

inputs.name: commentDes
inputs.value: There is an address object for this IP and this address object is a part of address group.

inputs.name: commentDes
inputs.value:
Below are the details:
Address group details:
@{body('Create_HTML_table_for_address_group_details')}
Address object details:

Create_HTML_table_for_address_group_deta.description: This creates table of objects from address group

inputs.name: commentDes
inputs.value:
There is an address object for this IP and this address object is not a part of predefined address group.
Below are the address object details:

Condition_to_check_if_Ip_already_present.description: condition to check the malicious IP address is present in the predefined address group

Create_HTML_table_address_object_details.description: This create table of content for address object

Filter_array_address_name_from_address_g.description: This filters the address name of address object from address group

inputs.name: Comment
inputs.value: There is no address object for this IP

Condition_to_check_if_Ip_address_already.description: This checks if Ip is a member of any of the list of address objects

Construct_filter_for_address_object.description: Filter construction to apply on get the details of address object API call

Fetch_the_details_of_the_address_object.description: This gets the address object details

Get_address_group_details.description: This gets the address group details

allow-routing.description: allow-routing of  of an address group

color.description: color of  of an address group

comment.description: comment of  of an address group

exclude.description: exclude of  of an address group

fabric-object.description: fabric-object of  of an address group

Parse_JSON_for_address_group_dynamic_con.description: Parse JSON for the address group dynamic content

Parse_JSON_for_address_object_dynamic_co.description: Parse JSON for the address object dynamic content

Parse_JSON_for_the_address_object_body.description: Parse body of the address object

Parse_address_group_JSON.description: To parse the output of the function address group in to JSON

Initialize_variable_comment_.description: This is used to comment in the incident

Initialize_variable_filter.description: Initialize variable for function call to apply filter on API call
